required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Continuous Negative External Pressure in Preventing Upper Airway Impairment During Routine Colonoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness and Safety of Continuous Negative External Pressure (cNEP) in Preventing Sedation-Related Respiratory Impairment in Adults Undergoing Colonoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: The primary goal of this study is to determine the effectiveness and safety of delivering continuous negative external pressure (cNEP) to the upper airway as a means of preventing episodes of respiratory impairment (RI) such as hypoxemia, apnea and hypoventilation associated with the use of intravenous sedation in elective colonoscopy in adult patients.

primary_outcome.measure: RI Events in the cNEP Group Compared to the no cNEP Group, Where RI is Defined as Either: i Oxygen Saturation < 90% or ii. Apneas/Hypopneas of > 15 Sec Duration i. Oxygen Saturation <90% ii. Presence of Apneas or Hypopneas
primary_outcome.description: Mean RI events in the no cNEP group was 3.5 compared to 1.92 in the cNEP group (p=0.022)

secondary_outcome.measure: The Safety of cNEP as Determined by Adverse Events Reported by the Investigators.
The Incidence of Subjects With One or More RI in the cNEP Group Compared to the no cNEP Group.
The Frequency of Interventions to Alleviate RI in the cNEP Group Compared to the no cNEP Group.
secondary_outcome.description: interventions such as reduction of sedative medication or jaw thrust.

arm_group.description: cNEP @ -45 cmw is applied to the anterior surface of the neck with a soft collar attached to a vacuum source.
Routine care is administered without the application of cNEP.

intervention.description: The AMS consists of a silicone collar applied under the mandible to the anterior surface of the neck. The collar is attached to a vacuum source which delivers continuous negative external pressure to the upper airway.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects undergoing elective colonoscopy at the Study Site who have fewer than three or more than three positive responses on the STOP BANG questionnaire
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of severe cardiopulmonary or neurologic disease as determined by the investigator
- History of vascular fragility associated with cutaneous pressure
- History of hypersensitivity to silicone
- Inability to properly fit cNEP collar to the subject
- The presence of excessive facial hair in the region where the cNEP collar is positioned
- Known carotid vascular disease, previous major neck surgery or radiation therapy to the cervical region
- Presence of anatomical abnormalities in the neck or pharyngeal region (such as enlarged tonsils)
- Inability to provide informed consent

group.title: Active cNEP @ -45cmw
group.description: cNEP @ -45 cmw is applied to the anterior surface of the neck with a soft collar attached to a vacuum source. Airway Management System (AMS): The AMS consists of a silicone collar applied under the mandible to the anterior surface of the neck. The collar is attached to a vacuum source which delivers continuous negative external pressure to the upper airway.

group.title: no Intervention
group.description: Routine care is administered without the application of cNEP.

baseline.population: The number of participants in the cNEP group was estimated from the number required to show a 50% decrease in the primary endpoint compared to the no intervention group.

group.title: Active cNEP @ -45cmw
group.description: cNEP @ -45 cmw is applied to the anterior surface of the neck with a soft collar attached to a vacuum source. Airway Management System (AMS): The AMS consists of a silicone collar applied under the mandible to the anterior surface of the neck. The collar is attached to a vacuum source which delivers continuous negative external pressure to the upper airway.

group.title: no Intervention
group.description: Routine care is administered without the application of cNEP.

measure.title: History of sleep apnea
measure.description: history of sleep apnea as reported by the study participant

outcome.title: RI Events in the cNEP Group Compared to the no cNEP Group, Where RI is Defined as Either: i Oxygen Saturation < 90% or ii. Apneas/Hypopneas of > 15 Sec Duration i. Oxygen Saturation <90% ii. Presence of Apneas or Hypopneas
outcome.description: Mean RI events in the no cNEP group was 3.5 compared to 1.92 in the cNEP group (p=0.022)
outcome.population: Not all subjects were evaluable due to malfunction of the respiratory monitoring equipment in several.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
